column7: company_profile

Sika is a speciality chemical company which develops and manufactures products for the construction industry. The company focuses on the production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing and protecting in the building and the motor vehicle industries. The company was established in 1910 and is headquartered in Baar, Switzerland.
column37: The new local head office in Dhaka, enables Sika to benefit from the potential available in the local construction market, which has a total volume equivalent to SFr15bn and an annual growth rate of 12%.

column7: UAE-based NMC Group, together with its subsidiaries, provides professional private sector medical services. The group also owns businesses engaged in a range of areas, including trading, hospitality, pharmaceutical manufacturing, pharmacy chains, financial services, education, jewellery, advertising, real estate and information technology. NMC Group was founded in 1975 and is based in Abu Dhabi, UAE.

Teradyne is a supplier of automation equipment for test and industrial applications. Teradyne Automatic Test Equipment is used to test semiconductors, wireless products, data storage and complex electronic systems, which serve consumer, communications, industrial and government customers. The company was founded in 1960 and is based in Reading, Massachusetts.
column37: "After successfully venturing into the Indian and Sri Lankan markets, we are looking forward to setting up and growing in Bangladesh as the country can provide us with enormous opportunities to develop," said Pradeep David, general manager, Universal Robots South Asia.

column7: Honda Motor Company, together with its subsidiaries, engages in the development, manufacture and distribution of motorcycles, automobiles and power products primarily in North America, Europe and Asia. In addition, it sells spare parts and provides after sales services through retail dealers, as well as being involved in retail lending, leasing to customers and other financial services, such as wholesale financing to dealers. The company was established in 1948 and is based in Tokyo, Japan.

SGS is a multinational business solutions company which provides inspection, verification, testing and certification services. It has a network of more than 94,000 employees and operates 2600 offices and laboratories. SGS's core services can be divided into four categories. Inspection: SGS provides a comprehensive range of inspection and verification services to help to control quantity and quality, and meet all relevant regulatory requirements across different regions and markets. Testing: its global network of testing facilities, enable customers to reduce risks, shorten time to market and test the quality, safety and performance of products against regulatory standards. Certification: allows customers to demonstrate products, processes, systems or services are compliant with either national or international standards and regulations. Verification: ensures that products and services comply with global standards and local regulations. SGS was established in 1878 and is headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland.

Wartsila is a global engineering company. It is operational through three principal divisions: ship power, which focuses on ship power solutions, including engines, generating sets, reduction gears, propulsion equipment, automation and power distribution systems, as well as sealing solutions for the marine industry; services, which offers solutions that support the customers throughout the lifecycle of their installations, such as engine services, automation services, operation and management, reconditioning services, training services and ship services, and power plants, which offers power plants for the decentralised power generation market, including solutions for baseload power generation, grid stability and peaking, industrial selfgeneration, as well as for the oil and gas industry. The company was founded in 1834 and is headquartered in Helsinki, Finland.

UAE-based NMC Group, together with its subsidiaries, provides professional private sector medical services. The group also owns businesses engaged in a range of areas, including trading, hospitality, pharmaceutical manufacturing, pharmacy chains, financial services, education, jewellery, advertising, real estate and information technology. NMC Group was founded in 1975 and is based in Abu Dhabi, UAE.

Indian Oil Corporation (IOC), together with its subsidiaries, engages in refining, transporting, and marketing petroleum products in India. It is also involved in the exploration and production of crude oil and gas. The company also exports its products serving the consumer, industrial and marine sectors. The company was founded in 1959 and is based in New Delhi, India.

US-based MetLife, through its subsidiaries, provides insurance, annuities, and employee benefit programmes. The company provides variable, universal, term, and whole life products; individual disability income products; personal lines property and casualty insurance, including private passenger automobile, homeowners, and personal excess liability insurance; and variable and fixed annuities for asset accumulation and distribution needs, as well as mutual funds and other securities products. MetLife was founded in 1863 and is based in New York City, New York, United States.

Transsion Holdings, formerly known as Tecno Telecom, engages in the research and development, production, sale, and service of mobile communication products. The firm was established in July 2006 and is based in Shenzhen, China. The company changed its name in the second half of 2013.

Cementos Molins primarily manufactures and markets melted and Portland cement in Spain and internationally. It also manufactures, commercialises, and distributes concrete, aggregates, and mortar; and produces materials for the laying of ceramic tiles, facade and indoor coatings, and a range of special solutions and products for building and restoration work. In addition, the company engages in the production and marketing of Portland cement and limestone; and planning and manufacturing of urban architectural elements for facades, benches, streetlamps, pavements, and other outdoor elements. Cementos Molins sells its products under the PAM, BORADA, VAT, and REVAT brands. The company was established in 1928. In 2017, the company relocated its head office from Barcelona to Madrid, Spain.

Dachser provides logistics services in Europe and internationally. The company's remit includes air and sea freight transportation, food logistics, and rail services. Dachser was founded in 1930 and is headquartered in Kempten, Germany.

Capillary Technologies offers a customer analytics-driven integrated marketing platform that provides omni-channel solutions for retailers worldwide. It provides cloud-based software solutions that enable retail marketers to build, manage, and analyse customer data to gather deep insights and personalise customer engagement across social media, mobile, e-mail, online, and in-store channels. The company offers intelligent customer engagement suite of products through the customer engagement management platform. The company was founded in 2008 and is based in Singapore, having relocated from Bangalore, India in July 2012.
UK-based Standard Chartered is a banking and financial services company. Standard Chartered is headquartered in London, UK, and was founded in 1853.

Infobip develops wireless communication solutions for businesses. The company's work covers email, chat apps, WhatsApp Business, SMS, and other areas. The company was founded in 2006 and is based in London, UK.

Veon, a communications and technology company, through its subsidiaries, provides mobile and fixed-line telecommunications services. The company offers its services under the Beeline, Kyivstar, anglalink, Jazz, and Djezzy brands. The company was formerly known as VimpelCom and changed its name to Veon in March 2017. Veon was founded in 1992 and is headquartered in Amsterdam, the Netherlands.

Infobip develops wireless communication solutions for businesses. The company's work covers email, chat apps, WhatsApp Business, SMS, and other areas. The company was founded in 2006 and is based in London, UK.
Coca-Cola develops non-alcoholic beverages, including Diet Coke, Fanta, Sprite, and Simply. The company was established in 1886 and is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, US.

Emergent Payments is a value added payments provider whose flagship product Pay+ delivers over 200 payment methods in a single, scalable platform. The company specialises in high growth complex markets like Latin America, China, South East Asia and MENA. It adds value by managing all aspects of payments including tax, fraud, chargebacks and FX for digital merchants including, Samsung, DayBreak Games Company and Wargaming.Net, among others. The firm was founded in 2008 and is based in Palo Alto, California. It was originally named Live Gamer and changed its name in June 2015.
